alert.note: Alert for Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 26 at 4:22PM EDT until April 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL SEMINOLE AND SOUTH CENTRAL VOLUSIA COUNTIES... At 422 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sanford, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, Winter Springs, Lake Mary and Lake Jessup. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into a small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
